method.name: Adaptive differential evolution with optional external archive

reference.ref: I. Triguero, S. García, F. Herrera, Differential Evolution for Optimizing the Positioning of Prototypes in Nearest Neighbor Classification. Pattern Recognition, doi: 10.1016/j.patcog.2010.10.020, in press (2010).
J. Zhang, A.C. Sanderson, JADE: adaptive differential evolution with optional external archive, IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computation 13 (5) (2009) 945–958.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Prototype Generation. Positioning Adjustment.
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork:
DE begins with a population of NP individuals, each individual encodes a complete reduced set.
Initially, prototypes are randomly selected from the training set.
Next, mutation and crossover operators guide the optimization process.
Selection operator must decide which individual between Xi,G and Ui,G should survive in the population of the next generation G + 1
The algorithm returns the best individual found.

parameterSpec.param: Strategy: A number between 1-6, It indicates the mutation strategy, 1: Rand/1, 2: Best/1, 3: RandTobest/1, 4: Best/2, 5: Rand/2 6:RandToBest/2.
Crossover Type: You can select between the three existing crossover operators.
